definition: a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
to feast one's eyes
to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
to feast one's eyes on (idiom)

sentences.english: B: I hope I have time to see them all.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我有时间一饱眼福。

sentences.english: I stopped to feast my eyes on the cakes because I'm on diet.
sentences.chinese: 我正在减肥，所以只能到那些面包房去饱饱眼福。

sentences.english: Spring Festival Japan swam, absolute can let you see and have a look.
sentences.chinese: 春节日本游，绝对可以让你看饱眼福。

sentences.english: Yet its large TFT display is a feast for the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它的大TFT显示屏真是让人大饱眼福。

sentences.english: The tour of Guilin glutted my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 桂林一游使我大饱眼福。

sentences.english: Well, let's move on to today's Feast for the Eyes.
sentences.chinese: 好了，一起来进入我们今天的赏心悦目大饱眼福吧。

sentences.english: The authors' narration to various sports activities will surely make readers feast their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 作者对各种体育运动的叙述定会令读者大饱眼福。

sentences.english: We are so lucky to be able to see an authentic work of his.
sentences.chinese: 能看到郑板桥的真迹我们太有眼福了。

sentences.english: I hope I have time to see them all.
sentences.chinese: 但愿我有时间一饱眼福。

sentences.english: Let me just stand here a little and look my fill.
sentences.chinese: 让我在这儿站会儿，饱饱眼福。

sentences.english: The audience feasted their eyes on the wonderful performance.
sentences.chinese: 精彩演出让观众大饱眼福。

sentences.english: A walk around the West Lake is feast for the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在西湖漫步能让你一饱眼福。

sentences.english: In order to satisfy the audience's treat, and decided to play yesterday and then went on to say.
sentences.chinese: 为了以飨观众的眼福，决定接着继续说昨天的剧本。

sentences.english: The place abounds in sights on which the eyes may dwell with pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 那个地方有许多可以一饱眼福的景致。

sentences.english: As of Saturday, all you need is an Internet connection.
sentences.chinese: 如果是周六，你只需上网就可大饱眼福。

sentences.english: Are we okay just knowing they exist or do we go into them and enjoy them?
sentences.chinese: 仅仅知道它们的存在就行了呢还是进去一饱眼福？

definition: to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
to feast one's eyes
to feast one's eyes on (idiom)
happy knack for chancing upon fine food
the trip has not been made in vain/the trip has been well worthwhile/it's been a worthwhile trip
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
a feast for the eyes (idiom)/(of women) gorgeous/graceful/(of scenery) beautiful
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
broaden, expand one's horizons
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
beautiful face (of a young lady)
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
to covet/to envy
portrait/genuine appearance/real face
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
